{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3245455,"name":"Quinn","username":"quinnlindsey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-10-26T12:47:33.129Z","cooked":"

I have an issue if the motors hitting sides of the drivetrain and to combat this we would have to change the dimensions of the elevator so sprockets align however this isn’t an option with our current design. If anyone as an idea on how to combat this please help us out!

IMG_30761179×1312 113 KB

This is the current fix of tripling brackets however it ends up hitting the motor

Included in the Thrifty Elevator kit are spacers to raise the planetary off the plate. You could change those spacers within reason to clear anything else that’s interferring in your design -

image711×531 81.8 KB

Assembly Guide Link here for more information
